content.description:
Victorem captiva captivus, -i, m.: prisonersequar, non nuptanubo, -ere, nupsi, nuptum: to marry maritum; 
est mihi, quae lanaslana, -ae, f.: wool molliatmollio, -ire: to soften, aptaaptus, -a, -um, adj.: suitable manus.
content.question: In the sentence, what does sequar mean?

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
